title: [Large-Scale] Designing Productive Failure Strategies for Pharmaceutical Education: Project-Based Learning for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of pharmaceutical concepts and elementary science curriculum
context.additional_context: Project to develop a medication education program for elementary students by pre-service teachers

learning_goals: Learners can explain the process of establishing creative hypotheses and analyzing failure experiences to solve complex pharmaceutical problems.
Learners can diagnose scientific error causes and propose correction strategies by comparing peer error cases.
Learners can design a pharmaceutical education scenario applying productive failure strategies in a PBL (Problem-Based Learning) approach and develop an implementation plan.

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (Google Workspace, Miro, etc.)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
